Name: Bloodwood Tree
Authority: (F. Muell.) K. D. Hill & L. A. S. Johnson
Description: Corymbia tessellaris (syn. Eucalyptus tessellaris), Carbeen, Moreton Bay Ash, Black Butt. A Ghost gum tree ranging from small to 35 m. tall, forming a lignotuber. Bark rough on lower 1–4 m of trunk, tessellated, dark grey to black, abruptly changing to white-cream smooth bark above that is sometimes powdery. Name from Latin: tessellaris - tessellated, referring to the rough bark in small squares.
